election_record.label: New York 1804 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: The town and county totals given here add up to the statewide totals given above. The official canvass of votes, however, lists 30800 votes for John Broome and 21638 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Broon.

sub_unit.name: Coeymans
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 79 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Guilderland
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 90 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Champlain
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) lists 24 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: "John Broome for Lit. Governor. . . [was] suported almost unanimously through this county." Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY). May 26, 1804.

sub_unit.name: Petersburgh
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), Northern Budget (Troy, NY), Troy Gazette (Troy, NY) and Lansingburgh Gazette list 109 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Schodack
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 112 votes as John Brown.
The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) lists 190 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Troy
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) lists 212 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Greenfield
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY) lists 169 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Fairfield
sub_unit.note: Oliver Phelps received 4 votes as Oliver Pheleps.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Boome.

sub_unit.name: Chatham
sub_unit.note: The Bee (Hudson, NY) and The Albany Register (Albany, NY) list no votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Gallatin
sub_unit.note: The Bee (Hudson, NY) and The Albany Register (Albany, NY) list 121 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Carmel
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) and the American Citizen (New York, NY) list 11 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Phillips
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 41 votes as John Bloom.

sub_unit.name: Poughkeepsie
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY) lists 226 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Bloom.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Bloom.

sub_unit.name: New Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 35 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Haverstraw
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 12 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Brown.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY) and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) list 1158 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Marlborough
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) and Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) list 38 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: New York
sub_unit.note: Oliver Phelps received 1 vote as Oliver Philips.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), American Citizen (New York, NY) and The Albany Register (Albany, NY) list 208 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Castletown
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 57 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Southfield
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), American Citizen (New York, NY) and The Albany Register (Albany, NY) list 38 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Suffolk
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) and The Albany Register (Albany, NY) list 1251 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Southampton
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 351 votes for John Broome and 40 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Southold
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) and The Albany Register (Albany, NY) list 119 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Western
sub_unit.note: The town and county votes add up to the Western District total given here. The official canvass of votes, though, lists 10756 votes for John Broome and 7596 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Cayuga
sub_unit.note: The original election returns for Cayuga county lists the vote totals listed here. However, the official canvass of votes lists 858 votes for John Broome and 642 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Dryden
sub_unit.note: "The number of votes given in Dryden is not written at length in the transcript as required by law; the return is made in figures." The Albany Register (Albany, NY). June 16, 1804.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: The Western Oracle and the Chenango Weekly Magazine lists 1537 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: In 1802, Genesee county was formed from part Ontario county, but the two continued to vote together in 1804, and most newspapers list returns from both counties together.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Boome and 2 votes as John Broomer.

sub_unit.name: Harrisburgh
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists not votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Trenton
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 48 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Westmoreland
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists 63 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: In 1802, Genesee county was formed from part Ontario county, but the two continued to vote together in 1804, and most newspapers list returns from both counties together.
The Ontario Freeman (Canandaigua, NY) and The Albany Register (Albany, NY) list 777 votes for John Broome.

sub_unit.name: Hartwick
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), the American Citizen (New York, NY) and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) list 99 votes for Oliver Phelps.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), the American Citizen (New York, NY) and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) list 114 votes for Oliver Phelps.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Dutchess County Historian, Poughkeepsie.
Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). April 28, 1804.
The Daily Advertiser (New York, NY). April 30, 1804.
The Balance, and Columbian Repository (Hudson, NY). May 1, 1804.
The Western Oracle, and Chenango Weekly Magazine (Sherburne, NY). May 24, 1804.
